##Ban Illegal Wildlife Trade, experts recommend the introduction of a white list of edible animals

Wechat, chinanewsweekly

Function introduction, here is "China News weekly" the head of the weekly gentleman, the influence has the influence you. Come with me to break through the fog, to find the truth, to watch the Times.

The following article is from the Chinese Philanthropist magazine, by Fan Yinghua

China News Service, director, China Newsweek. Based in China, we focus on global charity and social issues, providing professional and rational reports and analyses with depth and temperature.

It remains to be seen how effective the ban on wild animals will be

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
On the afternoon of February 24, the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress voted to pass a decision on comprehensively banning illegal wildlife trade, putting an end to abusive practices of eating wild animals, and earnestly safeguarding the lives, health and safety of the people (the decision) , effective as of the date of promulgation.

"This is an emergency decision, " Lu Zhi, a professor of conservation biology at Peking University and Executive Director of the Research Center for Nature Conservation and Social Development, told the Chinese philanthropist. Given that a comprehensive revision of the Wildlife Protection Act is still a process, it is imperative that a specific decision be passed by the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress as soon as possible.

Before the amendment of the Wildlife Protection Act

The adopted decision focuses on the prominent problem of wild animal abuse, with the aim of banning the consumption of wild animals in a timely, clear and comprehensive manner and cracking down on illegal wildlife trade before relevant laws are amended, in order to maintain public health safety and ecological security, protect the People's health and safety to provide a strong legislative guarantee.

China's current "Wildlife Protection Law" prohibits the legal norms of wild animals, only the state key protection of wild animals and no legal source, not qualified quarantine of other protected wild animals.

According to Lu, the law classifies wildlife into three categories: first, the state focuses on protecting wildlife; second, local focuses and "three-haves" (animals with ecological, scientific and social values) , also known as non-state key state protection of wildlife. Among them, the state key protected animals are not allowed to be eaten, while others are allowed to enter the food market legally, provided that they are licensed by the Forestry Department for capture, domestication and management, as well as quarantine certificates issued by the Agricultural Department. The third category of Wildlife, which is not on any of the aforementioned lists, does not require special procedures to enter markets and restaurants.

On the basis of the Wildlife Protection Law, the decision expands the scope of legal adjustments, and establishes a system of total prohibition of the consumption of Wildlife, taking the overall prohibition of the consumption of wildlife as a guide.

The decision clearly stipulates that hunting, trading, transporting and eating wild animals must be strictly prohibited under the Wildlife Protection Law and other relevant laws. The total prohibition of eating the state protection of "important ecological, scientific, social value of the land wildlife" and other land wildlife, including artificial breeding, artificial breeding of land wildlife. It is completely prohibited to hunt, trade or transport any land wildlife that grows and breeds naturally in the wild environment for the purpose of consumption.

Experts recommend setting up a white list of edible foods

"decision" also provides for severe punishment of illegal consumption, trade in wildlife behavior, can be called "the most stringent history.

Whoever, in violation of the Wildlife Protection Law and other relevant laws and regulations, hunts, Trades, transports or eats wildlife shall be given a heavier punishment on the basis of the existing laws and regulations. The illegal consumption and hunting, trading and transporting of wild animals for the purpose of consumption added in this decision shall be punished by reference to the Provisions on the punishment of similar illegal acts in the law on the protection of wild animals and other laws.

Lu Zhi believes that the role of the decision remains to be seen. The Wildlife Protection Law amended in 2016 has some deficiencies in its enforcement, such as lack of transparency in enforcement information, lack of quarantine and market supervision.

On January 24 of this year, Lu Zhi gathered 19 scholars and academicians from universities and scientific research institutes across the country to sign and publish the initiative to stop illegal consumption and trade of wild animals and control major public health crises at source, and to draft and complete the "specific recommendations for managing wildlife use at source" .

Lv Zhi said that the current "wildlife protection law" from the ecological protection point of view more, but insufficient consideration of public safety. From the point of view of public safety, legislation should regulate the use of all wild animals.

Lu said the industry's stakeholders are the main opponents of the social debate over whether to ban the consumption of wild animals altogether. "In fact, after this outbreak, most people should stop eating wild animals. The market is bound to shrink, and practitioners should see this trend. "

Lu Zhi's suggestion is that the revision of the Wildlife Protection Law should first change the concept and establish a white list system, that is, all terrestrial vertebrates should be brought into the scope of the Wildlife Protection Law and not allowed to be eaten, in addition, a catalogue of edible animals was established. This is the opposite of the current law.

"One of the fundamental reasons for doing this is for public safety, because when a pathogen picks a host, it doesn't look at whether it is focused on protecting wildlife, " Lu said.

Appropriate compensation for farmers

In an interview, Zhao Xiang, director of the Center for Landscape and Nature Conservation, told China philanthropist that the General Direction of social development is definitely to ban wild animals, but the concept of wild animals in the wildlife protection law needs to be redefined. At present, the local legislation of Shenzhen City is preferable and has reference significance.

According to the "Shenzhen Special Zone Comprehensive Prohibition of Eating Wild Animals Ordinance (draft) " , Shenzhen will completely prohibit eating wild animals. At the same time, the regulations will formulate and promulgate the list of edible animals in the Shenzhen Special Zone, and clearly stipulate that no person shall consume or organize to consume any animals or products other than the list.

According to the draft, the list of edible animals in the Shenzhen Special Administrative Region includes artificially raised land animals such as pigs, cattle, sheep, donkeys, rabbits, chickens, ducks, geese, pigeons, quails, and Aquatic animal that are not prohibited by law or regulations. In the decision adopted by the National People's Congress, it was also emphasized that the artificially raised animals, such as pigeons and rabbits, which have been used for a long time and are technically mature and widely accepted by the people, belong to domestic animals and poultry and are subject to the provisions of the Animal Husbandry Law.

Behind the repeated prohibition of eating wild animals, there is a huge industrial chain. According to statistics, in 2017, the total forestry output value of terrestrial wildlife breeding and utilization industry reached 56.0351 billion yuan.

Lu Zhi said that there is a broad consensus among the public on a total ban on eating wild animals. The current opposition comes mainly from wildlife trade practitioners and related interest groups. "The industry has been developing for so many years, and there is a intertwined chain of interests behind it. The interests of farmers, especially those in poor areas, may also be affected, and they should be supported in their transformation, " Lu said.

Lu Zhi suggested that after the total ban on wild animals, the loss of farmers could be solved by subsidies in different ways, similar to the way in which the government gave subsidies after the country stopped natural forest logging in 1998.

Duty Editor: Feng Chao
